Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Biotech Bullsh*t

For those who want information on Genetic Modification by humans of Food,
here are a few resources that point out the scientific claims and those of
the protesters:

Definitions of GMO:

Genetic Modified Organisms according to the Gentechnikgesetz (GenTG)from
20.06.90 (Genetic Technique Law) in Germany are organisms whose genetical
material were modified in a way which is not found in nature under natural
conditions of crossbreed or natural recombination. The genetic Modified
Organism must be a biological unit which is able to multiply itself or to
transmit genetic material.
Examples of modifications covered by this law are DNS recombination
techniques in which vector systems are used; techniques by which genetic
material prepared outside of the cell is introduced directly in the
organism. These techniques include microinjection, macroinjection and
micro encapsulation, cell fusion as well as hybridization procedures by
which living cells are formed with a new combination of genetic material
using methods which are not found under natural conditions.

A US definition of GMO "The term "Genetically Modified Organisms" refers
to plants and animals containing genes transferred from other species to
produce certain characteristics, such as resistance to certain pests and
herbicides." In the European community Genetic Modified Organism and its
release to the environment are covered by following rules:
1.- Rule 90/220/EWG from 23.04.1990 concerning the release of Genetic
Modified Organism in the environment.
2.- Rule 90/219/EWG from 23.04.1990, modified by the Rule 94/51/EWG
concerning the use of GMO in closed systems. 3.- Novel Food Decree
concerning foods and ingredients which have not yet been used for human
nutrition in a worth mentioning extent before.This includes foods covered
by the Rule 90/220/EWG; foods initial prepared by means of Genetic
Modified Organism but not containing the initial GMO any more such as
sugar obtained from genetic modified sugar beet, foods with modified
primer molecular structure, foods which had been prepared with or from
microorganism, mushrooms or seaweed, foods which had been prepared with
unusual techniques which modify significantly the structure of the food.
The content of the German GenTG is similar to the content of the European
Rule 90/220 EWG and Rule 90/219/EWG.
The genetic modification of food has the prime score to produce food with:

longer shelf life,
better properties,
using less insecticides in agriculture.

Scientific:

The Institute of Food Science & Technology:
http://www.ifst.org/hottop10.htm

Areas covered in this document:

* Introduction and definitions
* Genetic modification across the species barrier
* Techniques of genetic modification
* Detection of GM foods
* Advantages and potential benefits of genetic modification
* Current GM foods and food ingredients
* Safety and regulation of GM foods
* Specific concerns regarding the safety of GM foods
* Environmental issues
* Socio-economic concerns
* Labelling
* Benefits versus risks =96 and the future
* Conclusions

OurFood Database of Food & Related Sciences
http://www.ourfood.com/Genetic_modification_food.html
http://www.ourfood.com/Genetic_modification_food.html#SECTION00110001000000=
0000000

Some of the true issues aside from concerns of safety, testing, labelling,
detection, environmental and socio-economic concerns include:

* Antibiotic resistance
* Allergenicity
* Potential toxicity
* The EMS syndrome
* The Pusztai potato history

Foodfuture: Balancing the debate on genetic modification in food and
farming

http://www.foodfuture.org.uk/

Human Genome Modified Foods and Organisms:
http://www.ornl.gov/sci/techresources/Human_Genome/elsi/gmfood.shtml

GM Products: Benefits and Controversies

Benefits

    * Crops
          o Enhanced taste and quality
          o Reduced maturation time
          o Increased nutrients, yields, and stress tolerance
          o Improved resistance to disease, pests, and herbicides
          o New products and growing techniques
    * Animals
          o Increased resistance, productivity, hardiness, and feed
efficiency
          o Better yields of meat, eggs, and milk
          o Improved animal health and diagnostic methods
    * Environment
          o "Friendly" bioherbicides and bioinsecticides
          o Conservation of soil, water, and energy
          o Bioprocessing for forestry products
          o Better natural waste management
          o More efficient processing
    * Society
          o Increased food security for growing populations

Controversies

    * Safety
          o Potential human health impact: allergens, transfer of
antibiotic resistance markers, unknown effects Potential environmental
impact: unintended transfer of transgenes through cross-pollination,
unknown effects on other organisms (e.g., soil microbes), and loss of
flora and fauna biodiversity
    * Access and Intellectual Property
          o Domination of world food production by a few companies
          o Increasing dependence on Industralized nations by developing
countries
          o Biopiracy=97foreign exploitation of natural resources
    * Ethics
          o Violation of natural organisms' intrinsic values
          o Tampering with nature by mixing genes among species
          o Objections to consuming animal genes in plants and vice versa
          o Stress for animal
    * Labeling
          o Not mandatory in some countries (e.g., United States)
          o Mixing GM crops with non-GM confounds labeling attempts
    * Society
          o New advances may be skewed to interests of rich countries

 The Pew Initiative on Food and Biotechnology ^SGenetically ...
http://pewagbiotech.org/research/survey7-01.pdf

AMA (CSA) Featured CSA Report Genetically Modified Crops and Foods ...
http://www.ama-assn.org/ama/pub/article/2036-4030.html

New Scientist: GM Foods: News about GM food and regulation
http://www.newscientist.com/hottopics/gm/

GM Food News:
http://www.connectotel.com/gmfood/

GM Food Controversies:
http://scope.educ.washington.edu/gmfood/

Kid Focus on GM Crops:
http://www.geocities.com/gm_crops/

Defra Environmental Protection:
http://www.defra.gov.uk/environment/gm/

WHO *World Health Organizaton): Biotechnology / GM Foods
http://www.who.int/foodsafety/biotech/en/
http://www.who.int/foodsafety/en/


Opposing Viewpoints:

GM-FREE
http://www.btinternet.com/~clairejr/Bits/home.html
http://www.btinternet.com/~clairejr/Articles/artic_1.html
Companies which use GM foods:
http://www.btinternet.com/~clairejr/Action/howto.html

Social Issues Research Centre:
http://www.sirc.org/gate/gm_food.html

Genetic Modification of Food: Argumentative Essay
http://www.planetpapers.com/Assets/835.php

Genetically Modified Food
Society > Issues > Science and Technology > Biotechnology >
Genetics > Genetically Modified Food

http://directory.google.com/Top/Society/Issues/Science_and_Technology/Biote=
chnology/Genetics/Genetically_Modified_Food/

Genetically engineered food:
http://www.globalissues.org/EnvIssues/GEFood.asp

CAMPAIGN TO BAN GENETICALLY ENGINEERED FOODS
http://www.netlink.de/gen/home.html

http://www.nutrition.org.uk/flairflow/booklets/FF4GMandFood.pdf

What's Wrong with Genetic Modification?
http://www.nutrition.org.uk/flairflow/booklets/FF4GMandFood.pdf

Organic Consumers Association:
http://www.organicconsumers.org/gelink.html

- Biotech Industry Fears Growing U.S. Movement Against Gene-Altered Foods
& Crops
http://www.organicconsumers.org/ge/zealand060804.cfm

Genetically Modified Foods:
Are They a Risk to Human/Animal Health?
http://www.actionbioscience.org/biotech/pusztai.html

What foods can you create by genetic modification?
http://www.bionetonline.org/English/Content/ff_cont2.htm

Report to Congressional Requesters:

http://www.gao.gov/new.items/d02566.pdf

Regarding Protests:

Protest news:

SF County Government to Vote on Supporting Anti-Biotech Protests
http://www.organicconsumers.org/biod/SFvote060704.cfm

http://www.organicconsumers.org/ge/sanfran060904.cfm

I have more links for those who are interested.

> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Philip.X.Diaz" <st_indigo@earthlink.net>
> To: "SFRaves" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
> Sent: Thursday, June 10, 2004 10:50 AM
> Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Biotech Bullsh*t
>
>
> > Blind faith in technology has lead us up the creek before, and I think
> > that rather than being against all biotech (which would be ridiculous),
> > the protests are more to do with how biotech crops, products,
> > medicines, etc. are pushed on the public with increasingly less
> > oversight and testing. Faith in our technology combined with inadequate
> > testing has given us such Great Things as Thialomide, MTBE, leaded
> > gasoline, and DDT, just to name a few.
> >
> > sure, some of the protesters have their heads up their asses, but i
> > think there's a good argument to be made for more testing and
> > oversight.  sadly nowadays, a big stink (blocking traffic, for one) has
> > to be made before anyone notices - unless, of course, you have a
> > multi-million $ advertising and PR budget.
> >
> > the bottom line is that we can't trust corporations to police
> > themselves, and there needs to be more accountability and testing
> > before the products of this powerful technology should be released. the
> > biotech convention is a perfect place to bring these issues to light.
> > It sucks that it's inconvenient for people living/working downtown, but
> > it's our responsibility as citizens of this country to protest and
> > speak up when necessary.
> >
> > -Philip-

From sfraves-return-113091-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Thu Jun 10 20:57:32 2004

From: dr_XeNo <dr_xeno@pacbell.net>

  red_stickman@yahoo.com

X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Biotech Bullsh*t

Hello all,

     I finally decided to leap into this fray.  For the record,
I work at a biotech conducting late stage cancer drug research
and heartily believe in its importance. However, I also carry a
partially cynical view of it and science in general and some of
the practices that go along with both (probably due to a minor
in Philosophy of Science and morals LOL).  
    Hey Stickman, do you work in biotech too??

    Anyway, what Michael said before about all of the protestors
owing their life to GMO-based medicine is true.  Virtually all
of the anitobiotics that are currently still useful have been
maunufactured and/or developed using GMO bacteria.  Unless
you've never had AB's while ill, just go ahead and move to the
back of the picket line.
    As for what you wrote, Philip, a little clarification is in
order from someone who works on the front lines.  
    Now I'm guessing you meant Thalidomide, and not
"Thialomide."  It turns out that, yes, it was not tested well
enough in the 40's and 50's during development to know that it
caused severe birth defects when originally marketed as a
sleeping aid.  No companies test on pregnant woman for obvious
reasons.  Now, science has moved by friggin' leaps since then,
as has the FDA's regulations and processes by which new drugs
are reviewed for approval...more on that later.  Using more
modern science, it has been determined that one of the only
treatments for Multiple Myeloma, a very severe form of cancer of
the bone marrow, with an 80% mortality rate.  Thalidomide
currently being developed by Celgene as Thalomide has proved to
be only one of two current treatments that significantly
increase survival time for these patients.

http://www.nci.nih.gov/clinicaltrials/results/thalidomide-comeback0500

    As for lack of testing or oversight...do you know that the
average time that it takes to develope a drug and bring it to
market, *after,* the 5 or so years to determine a good target
for a particular disease, is 12 YEARS!  That is a *hell* of a
lot of "testing."  The last 6-8 of those years are spent in
continual contact with and with oversight by the FDA.  Then you
have to wait up to 1.5 years (typically shortened now to about 1
year) for approval by the FDA after filing your New Drug
Application (NDA).  Over 90% of all NDA's are not approved.
   Now, I have beef with biotech's and especially with Big
Pharma.  I believe that drug companies should not be allowed to
market their drugs to patients, ie commercial advertisment as if
it were a beer.  The amount of money spent on that is completely
irresponsible and wasteful.  The billions spent yearly should go
to further durg development and basic research.
   Now, I also have beef with the FDA.  They loosened
restrictions on advertisements in the late '90s, resulting in
all this wasted time and money spent on ads.  Another problem
with GMO technology is that it is not *nearly* as regulated as
drug development.  I think the same review process should be
initiated for GMO food stuffs and crops as it is currently being
used to regulate the drug industry.
   That's my two cents....well, maybe more!  Take care...



--- VanMundegaarde <ElectroFunk138@hotmail.com> wrote:
> Too bad not one protestor I saw or heard said ANYTHING about
> the lack of
> testing - and almost EVERY one just said "Genetically altering
> food is
> evil".
> 
> Seemed a bit frivolous to me.
> 
> M-
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From: "Philip.X.Diaz" <st_indigo@earthlink.net>
> To: "SFRaves" <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
> Sent: Thursday, June 10, 2004 10:50 AM
> Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Biotech Bullsh*t
> 
> 
> > Blind faith in technology has lead us up the creek before,
> and I think
> > that rather than being against all biotech (which would be
> ridiculous),
> > the protests are more to do with how biotech crops,
> products,
> > medicines, etc. are pushed on the public with increasingly
> less
> > oversight and testing. Faith in our technology combined with
> inadequate
> > testing has given us such Great Things as Thialomide, MTBE,
> leaded
> > gasoline, and DDT, just to name a few.
> >
> > sure, some of the protesters have their heads up their
> asses, but i
> > think there's a good argument to be made for more testing
> and
> > oversight.  sadly nowadays, a big stink (blocking traffic,
> for one) has
> > to be made before anyone notices - unless, of course, you
> have a
> > multi-million $ advertising and PR budget.
> >
> > the bottom line is that we can't trust corporations to
> police
> > themselves, and there needs to be more accountability and
> testing
> > before the products of this powerful technology should be
> released. the
> > biotech convention is a perfect place to bring these issues
> to light.
> > It sucks that it's inconvenient for people living/working
> downtown, but
> > it's our responsibility as citizens of this country to
> protest and
> > speak up when necessary.
> >
> > -Philip-

Subject: RE: [sfraves] know any good east/south bay parties/dj clubs/etc?

I find that if I really want to party I have to drive to the city (which =
really isn't that big of a drive as it seems) Also you have BART in =
Fremont too.

As for San Jose, lets just say that the San Jose crowd is a strange =
crowd. I've had some really fun times at the Agenda lounge (and mainly =
in the basement) but it's sort of a hit or miss type thing and it's =
mostly all hiphop these days.

Just go to the city.

Osteen

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: Last (((THUMP))) at the DNA: this saturday!

Yeah their psytrance Thump parties will be moving to less frequent and
irregular parties, but as I understand it they'll be doing stuff at larger
venues when the parties happen.

The downtempo ThumpChill happens at Anu every Friday.

And next week Friday they're starting a Thump Live! monthly party at Living
Room Lounge for their Alice and other radio show residents that I'll be
playing at.  That'll move from downtempo to house to progressive/tribal
through the night.

-Andrew

Subject: RE: [sfraves] know any good east/south bay parties/dj clubs/etc?

I've always appreciated Clandenstine @ JohnnyV's on Wednesday nights..info
is at clubclandenstine.com - Good music, people and lots of fun, - one of
the better SJ events if you ask me. There's also Deep - SJDeep.net, they
do a lot of one offs, Aaron Jae has a new event in the South Bay - next
one is coming up - more info at djaaronjae.com, also, I'd recommend
Michael Liu's Secret Psychedlia party at the Savoy in Santa Clara, more
info @ illuminationrecords.com, lastly, I am fond of many events that go
on in Santa Cruz, check out http://www.13moontribe.org

Also, other event information can be found on the calendar @

http://www.hyperreal.org/raves/sf/calendar2/events

<3 Karina

the 'vs' thing is a matter of technicalities i do believe.  to start, mars
actually doesn't play the bay too often anymore.  when he does, its
primarily at the f8 or skills parties and he and mystre have different
timeslots.  i don't think they've done a 'vs' - meaning both of them
spinning the same timeslot on the same decks since the "mystre is returning
from europe" (or wherever he went a few years back) party.

Subject: [sfraves] BSP:  BAY AREA ALL STAR DJ CONFERENCE

--=====================_29712474==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed


SATURDAY, June 12th 2004, Club Six

True-Skool presents:

BAY AREA ALL STAR DJ CONFERENCE

True Skool presents The Bay Area All-Star DJ Conference, a gathering of 
turntablists, club djs and radio jocks who have made a huge impact on Bay 
Area hip hop culture. This event features the dream team, Triple Threat 
DJs, consisting of world renowned DJs, namely Apollo (Invisible Scratch 
Pickles), Shortkut (Beat Junkies), and Vin Roc (5th Platoon).

Representing 10-years in underground radio, the Beatsauce crew, consisting 
of J-Boogie, Wisdom, and Raw B will be exhibiting the skills which garnered 
them the SF Bay Guardian's Goldies Award in 1998.

As a member of the Coup, Pam the Funkstress is a pioneering woman in
the male dominated DJ world. Don't let the fact that she's a female fool 
you. Pam can cut, scratch, and juggle with the best of them. If you're 
lucky, you can catch her performing her patented "breast" scratch.

The icing on the cake is DJ Quest (Live Human/Space Travellers), the 
turntable artist and scratch innovator who coined the term "hamster 
scratch", a turntable technique recognized by DJs worldwide. DJ Quest's 
impressive battle statistics date back since '91.

PRICE: <http://www.ticketweb.com>$10 presale, $15 at the door
TIME: 9pm-4am
MUSIC: Hip-Hop
HISTORY:
<http://www.clubsix1.com/events/jun2004/%20http://www.true-skool.org>tru-skool.org 






Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org

House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm


"I see in the near future a crisis approaching that unnerves me and causes 
me to tremble for the safety of my country.  As a result of the war, 
corporations have been enthroned and an era of corruption in high places 
will follow, and the money power of the country will endeavor to prolong 
its reign by working upon the prejudices of the people until all wealth is 
aggregated in a few hands and the Republic is destroyed."
-Abraham Lincoln

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

  "I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

--=====================_29712474==.ALT--

----- Original Message ----- 
From: "Apollo" <apollo@speakeasy.org>
To: <sfraves@hyperreal.org>
Sent: Thursday, June 10, 2004 6:30 PM
Subject: [sfraves] BSP: BAY AREA ALL STAR DJ CONFERENCE


>
> SATURDAY, June 12th 2004, Club Six
>
> True-Skool presents:
>
> BAY AREA ALL STAR DJ CONFERENCE
>
> True Skool presents The Bay Area All-Star DJ Conference, a gathering of
> turntablists, club djs and radio jocks who have made a huge impact on Bay
> Area hip hop culture. This event features the dream team, Triple Threat
> DJs, consisting of world renowned DJs, namely Apollo (Invisible Scratch
> Pickles), Shortkut (Beat Junkies), and Vin Roc (5th Platoon).
>
> Representing 10-years in underground radio, the Beatsauce crew, consisting
> of J-Boogie, Wisdom, and Raw B will be exhibiting the skills which
garnered
> them the SF Bay Guardian's Goldies Award in 1998.
>
> As a member of the Coup, Pam the Funkstress is a pioneering woman in
> the male dominated DJ world. Don't let the fact that she's a female fool
> you. Pam can cut, scratch, and juggle with the best of them. If you're
> lucky, you can catch her performing her patented "breast" scratch.
>
> The icing on the cake is DJ Quest (Live Human/Space Travellers), the
> turntable artist and scratch innovator who coined the term "hamster
> scratch", a turntable technique recognized by DJs worldwide. DJ Quest's
> impressive battle statistics date back since '91.
>
> PRICE: <http://www.ticketweb.com>$10 presale, $15 at the door
> TIME: 9pm-4am
> MUSIC: Hip-Hop
> HISTORY:
>
<http://www.clubsix1.com/events/jun2004/%20http://www.true-skool.org>tru-sko
ol.org
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Moksha Tribe:  www.mokshatribe.org
>
> House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm
>
>
> "I see in the near future a crisis approaching that unnerves me and causes
> me to tremble for the safety of my country.  As a result of the war,
> corporations have been enthroned and an era of corruption in high places
> will follow, and the money power of the country will endeavor to prolong
> its reign by working upon the prejudices of the people until all wealth is
> aggregated in a few hands and the Republic is destroyed."
> -Abraham Lincoln
>
> "Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the
> rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become
> visible."
> -Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"
>
>   "I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of
> life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the
> beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club,
> party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to
that..."
> -Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves
>

For additional commands, e-mail: sfraves-help@hyperreal.org

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="us-ascii"; format=flowed

Newshawk: Elmer Elevator
Pubdate: Fri, 11 Jun 2004
Source: Guardian, The (UK)
Copyright: 2004 Guardian Newspapers Limited
Contact: letters@guardian.co.uk
Website: http://www.guardian.co.uk/guardian/
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/175
Author: Paul Kelso, in Lisbon
Note: You've read the piece, now have your say. Email your comments to
football.editor@guardianunlimited.co.uk
Bookmark: http://www.mapinc.org/find?420 (Cannabis - Popular)

IT'S OK TO SMOKE DOPE, ENGLAND FANS TOLD

Portuguese police officers will turn a blind eye to England supporters who
openly smoke cannabis during Euro 2004, having decided that a stoned crowd
is easier to control than a drunk one.

Lisbon police confirmed yesterday that England fans will not be arrested
for puffing on joints on the streets of the Portuguese capital, following a
recommendation from the Dutch authorities responsible for policing the
English during Euro 2000.

Four years ago England's match in Eindhoven, ironically against Portugal,
passed off peacefully as many supporters took advantage of the Netherlands'
liberal drugs laws. By contrast the game against Germany in the Belgian
town of Charleroi was marred by violence, much of it fuelled by alcohol.

Portugal has similarly relaxed legislation to the Dutch and the authorities
hope it will help them police the 50,000 supporters expected to arrive in
the country in the next few days.

Possession of small amounts of cannabis is not illegal in Portugal but,
technically, consumption is. However, having liaised with the Dutch, police
will not act except in extreme circumstances.

Isabel Canelas, a spokeswoman for the Portuguese police, said cannabis
would be a low priority during the tournament. "Everyone knows that here
everyone can smoke. The police are doing another kind of job and their
priorities are different.

"We won't be hiding behind doors waiting for someone to smoke a joint. We
have to use common sense. If people are smoking but not kicking each other,
not beating each other, and not making a problem, why on earth would an
officer go and ask 'Is that cannabis?'

"If you are quietly smoking and a police officer is 10 metres away, what's
the big risk in your behaviour? I'm not going to tap you on the shoulder
and ask 'What are you smoking?' if you are posing no menace to others. Our
priority is alcohol.

"Of course, if people cause a problem through using drugs and become a
menace to others, police will be expected to take action. It would be
totally different when a police officer realises there's someone trying to
sell."

Visitors to Lisbon do not have to try too hard to buy the drug. The city
does not have "coffee shops" in the Dutch style, but tourists are likely to
be offered cannabis by street vendors.

Organisers have not restricted the amount of alcohol on sale during the
tournament despite the Football Association's concerns. Beer costs just 66p
a glass and will be freely available around stadiums and at big screen
locations.

Eindhoven police spokesman Johann Beelan said cannabis was a positive
influence on public order at Euro 2000. "Cannabis ... was part of the
conditions which meant everyone had a good time," he said.

British police estimated around 3,000 English supporters had arrived in
Portugal by last night, but there have been no reports of disorder and no
arrests.

"I see in the near future a crisis approaching that unnerves me and causes 
me to tremble for the safety of my country.  As a result of the war, 
corporations have been enthroned and an era of corruption in high places 
will follow, and the money power of the country will endeavor to prolong 
its reign by working upon the prejudices of the people until all wealth is 
aggregated in a few hands and the Republic is destroyed."
-Abraham Lincoln

"Music is prophecy, its style and economic organization are ahead of the 
rest of society. It makes audible the new world that will gradually become 
visible."
-Jacques Attali in his seminal text "Noise"

  "I loved the focus in the early days of Wicked on the pagan aspects of 
life. The natural cycles of the full moons, being out in nature, on the 
beach, free, alive, unbridled, wild and spontaneous. There is no club, 
party or other sound system that has ever achieved anything close to that..."
-Jeno, on the early days of Wicked and the Full Moon Raves

Subject: [sfraves] NEDMC News***Dj Swamp/New Panel/Exhibit Specials***


***The National Electronic Dance Music Conference***

***News***


Dj Swamp to lead the Dj Techniques:Turntablism seminar:

      We are proud to announce that Dj Swamp will be leading our Turntablist
seminar. For those of you who haven't heard of him, please visit
http://www.djswamp.com.

New panel added:

      We have added a panel due to popular request. The panel is "Women in
the industry" and will deal with womens issues in the industry as well as
showcase resources for women Dj's. Will feature members of Shejay.net

Registration specials announced:

      We have decided to hold registration specials from now until the end
of June, available through online ordering ONLY. The specials are as
follows:

Regular Registration-regular price, $275, special price $250
Economy Registration-Regular price, $150, special price $125
8x10 Exhibit Booth-Regular price, $1500, special price $1200
8x20 Exhibit Booth-Regular price, $2250, special price $2000

These specials end June 30th

  In Washington D.C. on September 3rd through 6th 2004, the National EDM
Conference will take place at the Omni Shoreham Hotel. We will be utilizing
the entire space of the hotel to bring you the best possible environment to
network with others in the EDM industry. We will be hosting all genres, from
hip hop to hardcore, from house to industrial. As well, we will also be
showcasing the newest technologies for the coming year and beyond, as well
as offering seminars and focus groups to help dj's, producers, and gear
manufacturer's push the envelope of music production and presentation.

  We have chosen D.C. to host this event because it is a central location on
the east coast, offering easy access from many spots around the country, as
well as being home to one of the nations largest EDM focused communities. We
will be working closely with all businesses involved to ensure top notch
production on all sides for after hours events, as well as demonstrations of
said products. There will be also attendee only events, so be sure to sign
up early to gain access to these events, held exclusively in the hotel.

  If you are interested in speaking on a panel or having your company host a
seminar, please email seminars@nedmc.com

  To stay up to date on all the happenings of the NEDMC, including seminar
information, hotel and registration discounts, and event information, please
visit http://www.nedmc.com/contact.html

  For further information on either sponsoring, exhibiting, attending, or
hosting an official event, please email info@nedmc.com , or visit our site
at http://www.nedmc.com .

  If you would like to help out with the NEDMC, please e-mail work@nedmc.com
for intern and volunteering opportunites.

  For booking consideration, please send all cd's to:
NEDMC Booking
4331 Farm House Lane
Farifax, VA 22032


http://www.nedmc.com
The National Electronic Dance Music Conference
P.O. Box 3616
Fairfax, VA 22038

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Jenny Zubiate Needs You!!!! june 18th

Yes, ladies and gentleman. On Thursday morning, june 17th at 7:30 AM, your 
friend JZ is having reconstructive ACL surgery on her left knee. "How is she 
gonna dance?" I wonder the same question myself.  For those of you who do 
not know Jenny...She has been dancing her cute, loud and wonderful little 
ass off in the SF party scene since 1996.  She is such a wonderful spirit, I 
am so glad to call her my best friend.  At the party she will be hung up, 
resting with her knee all openned up, and not able to dance or work.  If you 
know JZ, you know how much dancing means to her, for you who do not know 
her, she has been dancing as a way of expression and release for waaaaay 
long, even choreographing many dances in HS and college.  When she told me 
about this my heart sank....it sucks..
But we are going to help DAMN IT!!! hahahaha


Think happy, healing thoughts for her and please come and support her as she 
cannot work for a good month and a half or so.  This is a fundraising party 
to help cover medical costs.

So here it is Ladies and gentle-men
Friday, June 18th Friends and lovers of the infamous Jenny Zubiate are 
helping her out!!!!!
Your DJ'S for UNDER THE KNIFE:
Shazbot (Moksha Tribe, Teknotika @ newstylesound)
Lick the Micron (FnF)
Donna Matrix (Newsbreaks)
Danny Picard(my butt smells funny, extreme island happiness)
Calamity Jane (Moksha Tribe)
Malachi (Disco Bitch Project)
Music from 10pm to 6am
$10---2000$$ sliding scale donation -- a party to benefit my sugery costs.
Call 415 205 2223 for location details the day of the party.
Much Love to you all, I hope you are well and hope to see you soon!

thank you!!
Danny

"Øder tis moodle in der noggin tu smacken der ouchey und vinger-slingers ur 
to smacken-backen und fix de morkin, yøobetcha! "
-The Swedish Chef

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] nrr: Monsanto vs. Argentina

ok. more info on the biotech thing. a South American country just
experienced a major economic and agricultural crisis as a direct
result of doing business with an agribusiness company which was
selling GMO crops. don't quote me on this kz I never remember precise
details with 100% accuracy, **BUT** I think the company was Monsanto
and the country was Argentina. (a quick Google could probably verify.)

anyway what happened is that Monsanto basically convinced large
portions of the Argentinian population and government to switch to
Monsanto's soybeans, which are genetically engineered to resist
pesticide damage caused by one of Monsanto's pesticides. unfortunately
they are also engineered to be sterile, so that instead of the farmer
being able to plant seeds from his previous crop, he has to buy the
next generation of seeds from Monsanto every year. as you can imagine
it took Monsanto lots of money to persuade them this was a good idea.
(because it isn't.)

anyway the seeds did not perform as advertized and additionally the
seeds were spread by the wind, contaminated nearby fields, and turned
previously abundant strains of soybeans sterile. famine and recession
resulted, and Monsanto took no financial responsibility for the
massive and wholly detrimental effects on both the Argentinian economy
and the ability of the average Argentinian to find dinner, lunch,
and/or breakfast on a regular daily basis. in other words, people
died, jobs disappeared, and massive stretches of the countryside are
now dead and empty, where they once held healthy fields.

curing cancer: good.
causing famine and recession: not so good. hardly good at all.
possibly even BAD.


Giles B

It takes courage to push yourself to places that you have never been
before. To test your limits. To break through barriers. And the day came
when the risk it took to remain tight inside the bud was more painful than
the risk it took to blossom. - Ana=EFs Nin

Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to
replenish it's source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It
dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of
tarnishings. - Ana=EFs Nin

Friday, June 11, 2004 ** Origin Underground / HotTrance.COM **

This Friday! June 11th, 2004

Origin Underground at Club Ten15 (San Francisco)

lenn, both from Seattle, bringing their unique style to the Bay Area. Also =

Saturday, June 12, 2004 ** Loveworks presents: Love Injection **

Loveworks, the spark that has grown into an intense eight year inferno comb=
ining house music, art, and cutting edge atmospherics continues it=92s seri=
es of monthly audiosocial experiments and gives San Francisco a =91 LOVE IN=
JECTION =91 on Saturday June 12th =9204 at their homebase=97 the 111 Minna =
Gallery in San Francisco=92s SOMA District.  This special event will be a c=
ollaboration with SF based deep house music label LOVESLAP and features spe=
cial guest DJ's MAURICIO AVILES & CHARLES SPENCER from the label itself ( s=
ee BIOS below ! ).  Also supporting the guests is Loveworks resident dj DAV=
ID HARNESS, who is also an artist on Loveslap=92s roster; mmm=85 all the be=
tter to groove you with !  At the door will our guardian RAUL celebrating h=
is 40th birthday as well as guest services by the nicest man in security, B=
IG DAVE.  Your hosts for the evening are the inimitable NORI CASTILLO and D=
IANNA JACOBS who were instrumental in the creation of the legendary TOONTOW=
N parties as well as CAREFREE DANCING, the original house party at 177 Town=
send.   Your other hosts for the evening are TALY, JIM & NIKITA.  Also in t=
he early part of the evening, The Loveworks Classics Caf=E9 kicks off the n=
ight properly at 8pm with a special Classics Caf=E9 event starring Haight s=
treet=92s excellent Rooky=92s Records crew; featuring Rooky and DJ Goldmyne=
 spinning and selling fabulous 60's & 70's soul.  Vintage rug-cutting- come=
 "Butter your Popcorn" and "Shake your Moneymaker."  Dig it ?

Bio: MAURICIO AVILES
Born in the capitol of El Salvador in 1969, Mauricio Aviles immigrated with=
 his parents to San Francisco, California in 1973. Growing up in the Missio=
n District, he was constantly surrounded by the latin rhythms of the barrio=
=2E His father had a company that produced theatrical and musical events th=
at featured 'la cultura latina', and eventually Mauricio became involved wi=
th his father's creative enterprise, helping to produce several festivals a=
nd concerts in the Bay Area. The people and the music of this period provid=
ed the foundation for Mauricio's involvement in the City's burgeoning dance=
 scene that evolved throughout the 90's.
As a dj Mauricio's first actual gigs began at the City's bastion of undergr=
ound vibration, the EndUp. As a protege of Arron Olivares, Mauricio began f=
orming his own sounds and creating a devoted following that are still with =
him today. His next regular residencies were simultaneously Corazon, a lati=
n flavored weekly in the heart of the Mission District, and Metrojazz a ver=
y popular and original weekend event that successfully combined down tempo,=
 abstract beats and house, a hybrid that would eventually become to describ=
e the 'San Francisco Sound'.   Acknowledging the urban, afro origins of dan=
ce music, with a personal blend of his own latino roots, and a constant end=
eavor to break new ground, Mauricio's sound is hauntingly personal, emotion=
al and consistently fresh. Creating a niche within the deep house sound, hi=
s style, though ethereal, is undeniably funky and always elicits a great re=
sponse on the dance floor.  Now with an internationally successful compilat=
ion under his belt (Naked Music's Nude Dimension II), Mauricio has begun hi=
s production career with a debut single slated for release in Summer 2001. =
As an emissary for Naked Music, Mauricio has also commenced a global tour, =
ensuring that America's hottest new dance label is well represented.  Mauri=
cio has of late done production work and dj=92d under the moniker of MOVIDO=
, his project with collaborator and Loveslap label founder Charles Spencer.

Bio: DAVID HARNESS
In 1990, David began DJ'ing in his hometown of Monterey, California, at the=
 After Dark. As his popularity grew past the boundaries of Monterey, he was=
 invited to establish a residency at Tilt, and Sound Factory, in San Franci=
sco. In 1992, as David's popularity continued to grow he, along with DJ, Ru=
ben Mancias and promoter Joseph Solis opened a hip and popular club, Lift, =
at Club Dv8. David joined Bay Area legendary DJ, Pete Avila and host Foxxee=
 Brown on 'Your Mama's House', on the Bay Area's popular radio station KMEL=
 FM. Being the only "true" house mix show on any Northern California radio =
station, DJ's David Harness, Pete Avila and host Foxxee Brown have played a=
 key role in furthering House Music in the Bay Area. Also during that year,=
 David established a residency at San Francisco's legendary Club Universe. =
David Harness has quickly become one of the most well known and popular DJ'=
s in the San Francisco Bay Area club scene. David's popularity continued to=
 soar, taking him around the world; and the opportunity to play with New Yo=
rk's Legendary DJ's, Frankie Knuckles, Tony Humphries, Little Louie Vega, T=
edd Patterson, Dave Morales, London's Ricky Morrison, Danny Teneglia, Marqu=
es Wyatt- to name a few. He has appeared in articles and interviews in Bill=
board Magazine, Paper Magazine, Surface, XLR8R, Urb, Streetsounds, Sweater,=
 HX, Next and the Bay Guardian.



Bio: LOVEWORKS
Add a large helping of deep underground house music with a side of funk, a =
heap of disco, and a hint of techno, and you have the most nutritious dance=
floor experience available in San Francisco. Initially conceived by Dianna =
Jacobs and Nori Castillo of Toontown /  Carefree fame in the summer of '96,=
 Loveworks was envisioned as a refuge from the monotony of local clubs and =
superficial music, and  has become one of the bay area's most well known ni=
ghts out, while somehow remaining one it's best kept secrets.  It exists to=
 unite people of any race, social status or sexuality together in a comfort=
able and friendly club environment with music as the focal point, and in ad=
dition to it's monthly parties at the Minna Gallery, Loveworks also teams u=
p with other like minded parties around the city and has been featured at c=
lubs and parties such as Liquid, the Top, Electric, and the Endup.  Besides=
 late night dancing, Loveworks has also been involved in events for Wired M=
agazine, Apple Computer, Sony Digital, Construct Internet Design, and a hos=
t of others. Loveworks also had the honor of winning the SF Bay Guardian=92=
s =91 BEST HOUSE CLUB =91 in 1999.


Bio: 111 MINNA GALLERY
111 Minna Gallery is a dynamic =91contemporary art salon=92 that provides a=
n arena for multi-dimensional artistic expression in a community atmosphere=
=2E The goal of the =91gallery-as salon=92 concept is to nurture and suppor=
t a communal gathering of artists and a collaboration between diverse art f=
orms. This goal is achieved through six-week rotations of visual art exhibi=
tions curated by the staff combined with a variety of music and film events=
=2E =91Minna=92 is not only the name of the street on which the gallery is =
found but also translates from Japanese as "everybody," an all-inclusive te=
rm that symbolizes the embracing environment of the space. The gallery, whi=
ch also offers two bars, is crafted in an eclectic, contemporary design wit=
h ample furniture inviting guests to leisurely relax and enjoy conversation=
 among friends. The combination of art, music, film, dance and conversation=
 found at 111 Minna Gallery creates a unique gathering place for a multi-se=
nsory experience.


( contact: Nori for information and guest list questions / 866 841 9139 ext=
 2016 / loveworksdancing@onebox.com )

Thursday, June 24, 2004 ** Fuzion Presents 100% Tony Humphries, A Bay Area =
Exclusive **

House music has evolved from the soulful, gospel-inspired sounds of disco, =
and it owes its emergence to the artistry of DJ Tony Humphries. His unmista=
kable style continues to leave an irreplaceable impression on the global da=
nce music industry having entertained at over 500 venues worldwide and prod=
ucing more than 200 studio remixes. Throughout tremendous recognition, nume=
rous awards and accolades from his peers, Tony Humphries has remained humbl=
e and true to the sound of what we call house music.

Please join us for this special one night engagement, with Djs Tony Humphri=
es, David Harness, Matt Mau and Bernard Cabigon. At =93Mighty=94 Located in=
 the heart of the SF design district, within blocks of both Hwy 101 and Hwy=
 280, Mighty boasts a 6,000 square foot expanse of beautiful hardwood floor=
s, 22=88 high ceilings, exposed brick walls, and gigantic wood pillars and =
beams throughout. Sound system comes to Mighty from the legendary Sound Fac=
tory in New York City. It is a classic Richard Long & Associates system wit=
h most of the original components lovingly restored for the venue.

Friday, June 25, 2004 ** SOMA Sessions: BAILEY **

SOMA Sessions is San Francisco's premier weekend Jungle/Drum 'n Bass party.=
  On every Fourth Friday we invite leading hand-picked DJ talents from arou=
nd the globe to play extended sets in an intimate setting which forms the i=
dea of the "session"...

Friday June 25, 2004

BAILEY (Metalheadz, Swerve, Breakbeat Science - UK)
Bailey's roots in Drum & Bass stretch back to the early days of UK pirate r=
adio. A talented DJ whose taste and selection span all styles of the genre,=
 he quickly became one of the premier DJs of the D&B movement. In 1996 he t=
ook a residency at Goldie's renowned Metalheadz night at the legendary Blue=
 Note. Over the years he has established his own radio show every Sunday on=
 BBC 1Xtra and joined Fabio's famous Swerve night in London. A favorite of =
the San Francisco scene, if you can't get down to this DJ you may be dead.

DJ M
SOUND:BOY

Thursday, July 1, 2004 ** The Phoenix Festival 2004 **

The Phoenix Festival 2004
www.phoenixfest.com

July 1st to July 5th
The Phoenix Farm -- Trout Lake, Washington
www.phoenixfest.com/images/adams1.gif

Ticket info: www.phoenixfest.com/tickets.html

In the re:evolutionary spirit of festivals such as Burning Man, Tribal Gath=
ering, Woodstock 1 & Earthdance, PHOENIX FESTIVAL is an annual autonomous m=
usic and arts festival which takes place over the Fourth of July
weekend in the scenic Pacific Northwest.

Featuring simultaneous performances on multiple stages by regional, nationa=
l and internationally recognized performers, Phoenix Festival provides a sa=
fe
and fun environment for thousands of participants to freely express themsel=
ves through the creation of theme camps, participatory workshops, special e=
vents, performance art, and a stunning variety of audio,
video, visual & interactive art installations.

Be sure to check out the webpage (www.phoenixfest.com) to get the full skin=
ny on art projects, theme camps, the marketplace, volunteer
opportunities and other community based events.

This year we have chosen to experiment a bit with the musical format. We've=
 dropped the main stage, opting instead to hand the reigns over to the comm=
unity and foster a totally autonomous environment. You will see
that these folks really took the ball and ran with it.

Below you will find the lineups for all of the stages, each broken up into =
their respective themes.

Live (Hip-Hop, Dub, Live Bands, Spoken Word, Culture Jam)
www.phoenixfest.com/live.html

Subject: Re: [sfraves] nrr: Monsanto vs. Argentina (12 things you might want
 to know about Monsanto)

An interesting addition to this thread are other documented cases of
Monsanto's contributions to society, our foodchain, agriculture and
biotechnology:

"...
Millions Against Monsanto http://www.organicconsumers.org/monlink.html

Biotech, Biotechnology, Roundup Ready, Soybeans,
seed saving, genetically modified organisms - If you're talking about
PCBs, Agent Orange, Bovine Growth Hormone, water privatization, biopiracy,
untested/unlabeled genetically engineered organisms, or persecuting small
family farmers, you're talking about the Monsanto Corporation.

1) * Monsanto Hid PCB Pollution for Decades
Source:
Archived Copy: http://www.organicconsumers.org/monsanto/pcbs010702.cfm
Original Copy: http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/articles/A46648-2001Dec=
31.html
Monsanto Hid Decades Of Pollution
PCBs Drenched Ala. Town, But No One Was Ever Told
By Michael Grunwald
Washington Post Staff Writer
Tuesday, January 1, 2002; Page A01

ANNISTON, Ala. -- On the west side of Anniston, the poor side of Anniston,
the people grew berries in their gardens, raised hogs in their back yards,
caught bass in the murky streams where their children swam and played and
were baptized. They didn't know their dirt and yards and bass and kids --
along with the acrid air they breathed -- were all contaminated with toxic
chemicals. They didn't know they lived in one of the most polluted patches
of America.

Now they know. They also know that for nearly 40 years, while producing
the now-banned industrial coolants known as PCBs at a local factory,
Monsanto Co. routinely discharged toxic waste into a west Anniston creek
and dumped millions of pounds of PCBs into oozing open-pit landfills. And
thousands of pages of Monsanto documents -- many emblazoned with warnings
such as "CONFIDENTIAL: Read and Destroy" -- show that for decades, the
corporate-giant concealed what it did and what it knew...

2) * Monsanto Brings Small Family Dairy to Court

Percy Schmeiser is a farmer from Saskatchewan Canada whose Canola fields
were contaminated with Monsanto's genetically engineered Round-Up Ready
Canola by pollen from a nearby farm. Monsanto says it doesn't matter how
the contamination took place, and is therefore demanding Schmeiser pay
their Technology Fee (the fee farmers must pay to grow Monsanto's
genetically engineered products). According to Schmeiser, "I never had
anything to do with Monsanto, outside of buying chemicals. I never signed
a contract. If I would go to St. Louis (Monsanto Headquarters) and
contaminate their plots--destroy what they have worked on for 40 years--I
think I would be put in jail and the key thrown away."

Rodney Nelson's family farm is being forced into a similar lawsuit by
Monsanto. Support Schmeiser, Nelson and hundreds of other family farmers
who are being forced to pay Monsanto to have their fields contaminated by
genetically modifeid organisms. Sign OCA's "Millions Against Monsanto"
petition. These petitions will be physically delivered to Monsanto and
related court hearings.

3)  * Multi-Billion$$ Monsanto Sues More Small Family Farmer

Oakhurst Dairy has been owned and operated by the same Maine family since
1921, and Monsanto recently attempted to put them out of business.
Oakhurst, like many other dairy producers in the U.S., has been responding
to consumer demand to provide milk free of rBGH, a synthetic hormone
banned (for health reasons) in every industrialized country other than the
U.S. Monsanto, the number one producer of the rBGH synthetic steroid, sued
Oakhurst, claiming they should not have the right to inform their
customers that their dairy products do not contain the Monsanto chemical.
Given the intense pressure from the transnational corporation, Oakhurst
was forced to settle out of court, leaving many other dairies vulnerable
to similar attacks from Monsanto.

4)  * Monsanto Claims its Agent Orange chemical isn't Toxic

Source: http://www.organicconsumers.org/monsanto/agentorange032102.cfm

Other Recommended Reading:
* The Issue That Wont Go Away
http://www.organicconsumers.org/monsanto/agentorange032102.cfm#the

* What Did We Know About Dioxin, and When Did We Know It?
http://www.organicconsumers.org/monsanto/agentorange032102.cfm#what

* What Did It Take to Forget What We Knew?
http://www.organicconsumers.org/monsanto/agentorange032102.cfm#did

* Agent Orange: 2002
http://www.organicconsumers.org/monsanto/agentorange032102.cfm#agent

* Recommended Reading
http://www.organicconsumers.org/monsanto/agentorange032102.cfm#reco

Monsanto's Agent Orange:
The Corporation Continues to Refuse Compensation to
Veterans and Families for Exposure to the Toxic Chemical

The negative health effects, due to exposure to Monsanto's Agent Orange,
have been well documented over the past three decades. The dioxin in Agent
Orange has been accepted internationally as one of the most toxic
chemicals on the planet, causing everything from severe birth defects, to
cancer, to neurological disorders, to death. But Monsanto has successfully
blocked any major movement towards compensating veterans and civilians who
were exposed to the company's Agent Orange.

Long before Agent Orange was used as a herbicide in the Vietnam war,
Monsanto knew of its negative health impacts on humans. Since then,
Monsanto has been unsuccessful at covering its tracks and has even been
convicted of fabricating false research documentation that claims Agent
Orange has no negative health effects, other than a possible skin rash.
Thanks to Monsanto's influence, the Center for Disease Control also
released a report claiming veterans were never exposed to harmful levels
of Agent Orange.

As a note, from 1962 to 1970, the US military sprayed 72 million liters of
herbicides, mostly Agent Orange, on over one million Vietnamese civilians
and over 100,000 U.S. troops. As a result, within ten years of the close
of the war, 9170 veterans had filed claims for disabilities caused by
Agent Orange. The VA denied compensation to 7709, saying that a facial
rash was the only disease associated with exposure.

In 2002, Vietnam requested assistance in dealing with the tens of
thousands of birth defects due to Agent Orange. In order to avoid medical
compensation expenses, Monsanto continues to claim this now banned
chemical is not toxic.

5)  * Taxpayers Forced to Fund Monsanto's Poisoning of Third World

Monsanto has also been implicated in the indiscriminate sale and use of
RoundUp Ultra in the anti-drug fumigation efforts of Plan Colombia. Of the
some $1.3 billion of taxpayers' money earmarked for Plan Colombia,
Monsanto has received upwards of $25 million for poviding RoundUp Ultra.
Banana crops damaged by Monsanto's Roundup Ultra.

RoundUp Ultra is a highly concentrated version of Monsanto's glyphosate
herbicide, with additional surfactants to increases its lethality. Local
communities and human rights organizations charge that Ultra is destroying
food crops, water sources and protected areas in the Andes, primarily
Colombia.

Paradoxically, the use of RoundUp Ultra has actually increased coca
cultivation in the Andes. As local farming communities are increasingly
impacted by RoundUp Ultra fumigations, many turn to the drug trade as a
means of economic survival. Regional NGOs have estimated that almost
200,000 hectares have been fumigated with Ultra under Plan Colombia.

6)  * Monsanto Takes Ownership of Public Water Resource

Over the past century, global water supplies have been contaminated with
the full gamut of Monsanto's chemicals, including PCBs, dioxin and
glyophosate (Roundup). So now the company, seeing a profitable market
niche, is taking control of the public water resources they polluted,
filtering it, and selling it back to the people. In short, Monsanto is
making a double profit by polluting the world's scarce freshwater
resources, privately taking ownership of that water, filtering it, and
selling it back to those who can afford to pay for it.

7)  * Monsanto's GE Seeds are Pushing US Agriculture into Bankruptcy
Source: http://www.organicconsumers.org/patent/exposed091702.cfm

Genetically engineered crops are causing an economic disaster for farmers
in the U.S. So says a new report released by Britain's Soil Association.
The report is a massive compilation of data showing GE crops have cost
American taxpayers $12 billion in farm subsidies in the past three years.
"Within a few years of the introduction of GM crops, almost the entire
$300 million annual US maize exports to the EU had disappeared, and the US
share of the soya market had decreased," the report said. In addition, the
study says that GE crops have lead to an increased use of pesticides,
while resulting in overall lower crop yields.

8)  * Monsanto's Ties to Government

A Monsanto official told the New York Times that the corporation should
not have to take responsibility for the safety of its food products.
"Monsanto should not have to vouchsafe the safety of biotech food," said
Phil Angell, Monsanto's director of corporate communications. "Our
interest is in selling as much of it as possible. Assuring its safety is
the FDA's job."

It would be nice to think the FDA can be trusted with these matters, but
think again. Monsanto has succeeded in insuring that government regulatory
agencies let Monsanto do as it wishes. Take a look:
=09Prior to being the Supreme Court Judge who put GW Bush in
office,Clarence Thomas was Monsanto's lawyer.

The U.S. Secretary of Agriculture (Anne Veneman) was on the Board of
Directors of Monsanto's Calgene Corporation.
=09The Secretary of Defense (Donald Rumsfeld) was on the Board of
Directors of Monsanto's Searle pharmaceuticals.

The U.S. Secretary of Health, Tommy Thompson, received $50,000 in
donations from Monsanto during his winning campaign for Wisconsin's
governor.
=09The two congressmen receiving the most donations from Monsanto
during the last election were Larry Combest (Chairman of the House
Agricultural Committee) and Attorney General John Ashcroft. (Source: Dairy
Education Board)

In order for the FDA to determine if Monsanto's growth hormones were safe
or not, Monsanto was required to submit a scientific report on that topic.
Margaret Miller, one of Monsanto's researchers put the report together.
Shortly before the report submission, Miller left Monsanto and was hired
by the FDA. Her first job for the FDA was to determine whether or not to
approve the report she wrote for Monsanto. In short, Monsanto approved its
own report. Assisting Miller was another former Monsanto researcher, Susan
Sechen. Deciding whether or not rBGH-derived milk should be labeled fell
under the jurisdiction of another FDA official, Michael Taylor, who
previously worked as a lawyer for Monsanto.

9)  * Organic and Natural Product Companies Associated with Monsanto

Organic and Natural Product Companies
Associated with Monsanto

=95 Brand Name(s): Arrowhead Mills, Bearitos, Breadshop, Celestial
Seasonings, Earth's Best Baby Food, Garden of Eatin, Health Valley,
Imagine Foods, Terra Chips, Westbrae, Millina's, Mountain Sun, Shari
Ann's, Walnut Acres Owned By: Hain Food Group Principle Stockholders: Bank
of America, Entergy Nuclear, ExxonMobil, H.J. Heinz, Lockheed Martin,
Merck, Monsanto, Pfizer, Philip Morris, Walmart, Waste Mangement Inc.
Significantly Owned By: Citigroup

=95 Brand Name(s): Cascadian Farms, Muir Glen Owned By: Small Planet Foods
Principle Stockholders: General Mills Significantly Owned By: Alcoa,
Chevron, Disney, Dupont, ExxonMobil, General Electric, McDonalds,
Monsanto, Nike, Pepsico, Pfizer, Philip Morris, Starbucks, Target, Texas
Instruments

10) Monsanto's Roundup Pesticide Linked to Cancer

Read study linking Monsanto's Roundup to Cancer.
Source: http://www.organicconsumers.org/Monsanto/glyphocancer.cfm

Monsanto also produces the most commonly used broadleaf pesticide in
the world, glyphosate--or Roundup. In addition to its inherent toxicity as
a chemical pesticide, Roundup has now been found to aid the spread of
fusarium head blight in wheat. This disease creates a toxin in the
infected wheat, making the crop unsuitable for human or animal
consumption. Canada's wheat industry is currently being ravaged by this
disease. At the same time, the widespread use of Roundup has resulted in
the formation of "super weeds" --- unwanted plants that have developed an
immunity to these pesticides. Read study linking Monsanto's Roundup to
Cancer.

11) Cotton Farmers Going Bankrupt from Monsanto's GE Cotton
Source:
http://www.organicconsumers.org/ge/bt_cotton.cfm
and
http://flonnet.com/fl2011/stories/20030606005912300.htm
http://www.genecampaign.org/nebt.html

In India the financial figures for the recent cotton growing season have
finally been crunched. Although Monsanto convinced many of India's farmers
that buying the more expensive GE cotton seeds would result in higher
yields and better cotton, the reverse is actually true. Crop yields for GE
cotton were 5 TIMES LESS than traditional Indian cotton and the income
from GE cotton was 7 TIMES LESS than conventional cotton, due to
Monsanto's cotton having lower quality short fibers. As a result of the
insurmountable deluge of debt accrued from paying more for the GE seeds
and having a weak crop, more than 100 Indian farmers committed suicide in
the last year.

12) Wheat Farmers Say No to Monsanto's GE Wheat

Source: http://www.organicconsumers.org/ge/bt_cotton.cfm
Original Article:
The Heartland Wrestles With Biotechnology

By Justin Gillis
Washington Post Staff Writer
Tuesday, April 22, 2003; Front Page

The Washington Post and other major publications have been highlighting a
massive new movement of conventional and organic farmers who are working
together to pass state legislation that would put a moratorium on
Monsanto's new genetically engineered wheat. North Dakota farmers recently
met with Monsanto representatives to express their concerns about the new
crop. Steven Pollestad, a conventional farmer, said, "The foreign buyers
have flat out said they won't buy it. And I believe they won't." (Read
more...)

Japan has announced to the US that if GE wheat is approved here, it is
likely they will completely discontinue importing wheat from American
farmers. This makes up a total of 2.5 million tons of US grown wheat each
year---enough to put thousands of family farmers out of business.
Similarly, South Korean officials gave the US similar warnings in May
2003. In the meantime, Monsanto continues to test its new GE wheat in
fields across the US, despite staunch farmer opposition throughout North
America. (Read more...)

Meanwhile, Scientists from the University of Manitoba have released a
report indicating, "Under current conditions the release of Roundup Ready
wheat in Western Canada would be environmentally unsafe." (Read more...)
Despite the landslide of data revealing probable negative impacts on the
environment, the economy and human health, the FDA is posed to approve
Monsanto's GE wheat. Why?

Read More: http://www.organicconsumers.org/ge/071403_ge_wheat.cfm
http://www.organicconsumers.org/ge/japan_wheat.cfm

Other Links Related to Monsanto:
Related: The Model City http://www.organicconsumers.org/monsanto/pcbs010702=
=2Ecfm#model

The Company Committee

Subject: [sfraves] jazz break! nrr

hello, we are taking a break from our regularly scheduled  fictional post to honor the frusterated, crying child and to celebrate jazz.  lots of elements of the music you love are rooted in jazz....this is just a reminder to you:  the next time you hear some good drum and bass, for example, consider also how it is actually a fusion of an african tradition that was further developed in america and the current available musical technology. if you do that, everything comes in crystal clear. :)

::yawn::

So by those standards only BSPs for free parties should be allowed on this
list, ok.

LOL, also since you're a subscriber to this list - you must have recieved my
open guestlist invitations to everyone on SFRaves for my last *4* events.

I can't believe you'd even try to imply that im concerned with making a
profit.   The fact is, there are operating costs for our dedicated server,
and the printing/design costs of the promotional material to make the site
popular in the first place, and making it a valuable resource for promoters.

DJs charge to play,  Print shops charge for flyers, Radio stations charge
for ads, and record stores charge a service fee on every ticket.  Its just
reality.

It comes down to this - we're asking for $50 and promising 30,000 views per
ad, thats cheap as hell. Unless the party is lame, the promoter will get
more then $50 in ticket sales back.  Do you disagree with that statement?
I tried to set it at a price that would still reflect a profit for the
promoter and help us pay the bills.

Get off your high horse bro.
-Ross

>From: "Ross" <ross@bayraves.com>
>::yawn::
>
>So by those standards only BSPs for free parties should be allowed on this
>list, ok.
>
>LOL, also since you're a subscriber to this list - you must have recieved 
>my
>open guestlist invitations to everyone on SFRaves for my last *4* events.
>
>I can't believe you'd even try to imply that im concerned with making a
>profit.   The fact is, there are operating costs for our dedicated server,
>and the printing/design costs of the promotional material to make the site
>popular in the first place, and making it a valuable resource for 
>promoters.
>
>DJs charge to play,

I do not, I play for the music...and it is fun...I will never charge to play 
anywhere...if people give me monmey, hey that is cool. I wont argue.  IT is 
a hobby, it is fun and it is releasing.
I understand your point, but... there have been lists in the scene in sf and 
everywhere that do not charge.  I think that if you are willing to pay, you 
must have some doubt on the return of the party.  If you have doubts, don't 
throw parties.  If you are throwing parties for money...DO NOT THROW 
PARTIES, they usually suck ass in my opinion on many levels.
Letting people know about the events should not have to cost anything...I 
have never paid to advertize for a party, and if you do...something is wrong 
with the music you are booking :P  shops charge for flyers, Radio stations 
charge

word of mouth never cost a thing, why should it now?

And Mr Ross...Andy is on his high horse, because he has earned it as an 
absolutely incredible key to the scene in SF.  You have no idea what  this 
boy has accomplished...and you prolly never will, he is one of the major 
reasons I have been partying since '96.  Thank you Andy.  Ross, I think you 
need to take a look at who is actually on a high horse bro...We are a part 
of a unique underground scene where it used to be about the simple 
things...that is all Andy was saying...  He is just witty and smarter than 
the average geriatric raver and most people can't hang
*danny tips his hat
Sr. Danny Picard
off to work.

>I can't believe you'd even try to imply that im concerned with making a
>profit.   The fact is, there are operating costs for our dedicated server,
>and the printing/design costs of the promotional material to make the site
>popular in the first place, and making it a valuable resource for 
>promoters.
>
>DJs charge to play,

I do not, I play for the music...and it is fun...I will never charge to play 
anywhere...if people give me monmey, hey that is cool. I wont argue.  IT is 
a hobby, it is fun and it is releasing.
I understand your point, but... there have been lists in the scene in sf and 
everywhere that do not charge.  I think that if you are willing to pay, you 
must have some doubt on the return of the party.  If you have doubts, don't 
throw parties.  If you are throwing parties for money...DO NOT THROW 
PARTIES, they usually suck ass in my opinion on many levels.
Letting people know about the events should not have to cost anything...I 
have never paid to advertize for a party, and if you do...something is wrong 
with the music you are booking :P  shops charge for flyers, Radio stations 
charge

word of mouth never cost a thing, why should it now?

And Mr Ross...Andy is on his high horse, because he has earned it as an 
absolutely incredible key to the scene in SF.  You have no idea what  this 
boy has accomplished...and you prolly never will, he is one of the major 
reasons I have been partying since '96.  Thank you Andy.  Ross, I think you 
need to take a look at who is actually on a high horse bro...We are a part 
of a unique underground scene where it used to be about the simple 
things...that is all Andy was saying...  He is just witty and smarter than 
the average geriatric raver and most people can't hang
*danny tips his hat
Sr. Danny Picard
off to work.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: Last (((THUMP))) at the DNA: this saturday!

yes - it will be a fun way to say goodbye and thanks for 5 years of monthly
(((thump))) parties.  we still plan on throwing some one-off parties, but it
has been "challenging" to maintain a monthly gig since 1999.  we've had some
truly magical moments with all of you, and they inspired us to keep going
for all this time.  we've had some blood, some sweat, and some tears.  we
couldn't have a more amazing act to celebrate this last monthly party with -
Absolum is top of the tops in the world of trance.  get ready for a rockin'
good time...

this party will also be a time of healing for us personally, and also, we
hope, within this community as thump radio and jimmy siegel finally came to
a settlement in our 2 year long dispute.  we both made some concessions, we
signed on the dotted line and gave each other big hugs.  its over.  we'll
all be there on saturday night and hope that you'll come join in our
celebration and our healing.

looking forward to a great saturday night...sunday morning...  bar opens up
again at 6am.  :)

peace, trance, and (((thump)))!

-bri

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Rev Moon Coronates Self As Messiah At US Senate

This is not a joke, it's all too real.

you' sort of way.

Check this photo out, for example:

http://www.iifwp.org/programs/IIPC/reports/forging_path/images/DC_20040323_05148.jpg

It happened on March 23d when 'Washington Times,'  most Republican
newspaper in the country, publisher Reverend Moon coronated
**himself** as The Messiah with the help of some of our leading
Representatives, Democrat and Republican.

http://portland.indymedia.org/en/2004/06/290588.shtml

http://gadflyer.com/articles/?ArticleID=131

Subject: [sfraves] Thump

i'd like to say that i had a fabulous time at Thump last night and was 
thorougly drenched in sweat when i left at 5:30am.

absolum assaulted me with some pounding, driving trance while the AM boys 
had my booty groovin to some of the funkiest, grooviest shit i've heard in 
awhile.  i tried to do the cabbage patch with AndyW but he was dancing a 
jig.

just when i thought i'd had enough and would spend the rest of the night on 
the sofa...someone came on in the back room and played *drum roll* BREAKS.  
and he played some of my favorite Plump DJs tracks and a remixed Rakim 
track.  i found my 2nd wind (or was it my 3rd of 4th?) and my toes were 
tapping like James Brown on crack.

to thump...i salute thee.  5 grand years of quite possibly the best monthly 
party i've been a regular attendee of.

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: News? US: Scientology Link to Public Schools

US: Scientology Link to Public Schools
URL: http://www.mapinc.org/drugnews/v04/n841/a07.html
Newshawk: Dale Gieringer
Webpage:
http://sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/chronicle/archive/2004/06/09/MNGO572ISD1.DTL
Pubdate: Wed, 9 Jun 2004
Source: San Francisco Chronicle (CA)
Copyright: 2004 Hearst Communications Inc.
Contact: letters@sfchronicle.com
Website: http://www.sfgate.com/chronicle/
Details: http://www.mapinc.org/media/388
Author: Nanette Asimov, Chronicle Staff Writer
Note: Chronicle researcher Kathleen Rhodes contributed to this report
Bookmark: http://www.mapinc.org/topics/Narconon

SCIENTOLOGY LINK TO PUBLIC SCHOOLS

As Early As the Third Grade, Students in S.F.  and Elsewhere Are Subtly
Introduced to Church's Concepts Via Anti-Drug Teachings

A popular anti-drug program provided free to schools in San Francisco and
elsewhere teaches concepts straight out of the Church of Scientology,
including medical theories that some addiction experts described as
"irresponsible" and "pseudoscience."

As a result, students are being introduced to somebeliefs and methods of
Scientology without their knowledge.
--------------------------------------------------------------

Is anyone here a scientologist? If so, do you know of a resource which can
validate or refute this claim?

Thanks
--

& in eluding the implacable grandeur of this life.
-- Albert Camus -- *******************************************

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: Jenny Zubiate Needs You!!!! june 18th


Yes, ladies and gentleman. On Thursday morning, june 17th at 7:30 AM, your 
friend JZ is having reconstructive ACL surgery on her left knee. "How is she 
gonna dance?" I wonder the same question myself.  For those of you who do 
not know Jenny...She has been dancing her cute, loud and wonderful little 
ass off in the SF party scene since 1996.  She is such a wonderful spirit, I 
am so glad to call her my best friend.  At the party she will be hung up, 
resting with her knee all openned up, and not able to dance or work.  If you 
know JZ, you know how much dancing means to her, for you who do not know 
her, she has been dancing as a way of expression and release for waaaaay 
long, even choreographing many dances in HS and college.  When she told me 
about this my heart sank....it sucks..
But we are going to help DAMN IT!!! hahahaha


Think happy, healing thoughts for her and please come and support her as she 
cannot work for a good month and a half or so.  This is a fundraising party 
to help cover medical costs.

Friday, June 18th Friends and lovers of the infamous Jenny Zubiate are 
helping her out!!!!!

thank you!!

Subject: Re: [sfraves] BSP: Mighty Breaks w/ Grandmaster Flash and 2 Bad Mice

niiice, and happy pre-un-belated b-day 2 u!

The Onion ran a piece a few yrs back about God giving a mad shout-out
to all the rappers who ever mentioned him on their liner notes.

Well, my girlz has like 5,000 pieces of vinyl dating back to like 1965
and she swore up and down that she had a copy of The Message and after
a year of searching thru her stacks I finally found it.

The reason I couldn't find it was that she dinnt have the 12 inch, but
the *actual* motehrflucking record that the 12 inch came offa.

how cool is that?

Sure enuff, first thing on their first record is a thank u 2 god.

who knew?

who knew that this crew was going 2 have the impact that it did?

don't know about u, but i'm sure as fuck glad they did.

just 2 keep myself in check this past week w/all the Iddy Ronnie
Raygun hype, which i dinnt believe, having lived thru it, The Message
was in heavy MTV stylee rotation back here @ the ranch.

Enjoi the show.

nwa

From sfraves-return-113162-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org Tue Jun 15 07:04:19 2004
Return-Path: <sfraves-return-113162-sfraves-archive=hyperreal.org@hyperreal.org>

Received: (qmail 4422 invoked from network); 15 Jun 2004 07:04:18 -0000
Mime-Version: 1.0 (Apple Message framework v618)
In-Reply-To: <20040614112853.M53544@taz3.hyperreal.org>
